name: Coconut Waikiki Hotel, a Joie de Vivre Hotel

reviews.title: Great hotel with great service
reviews.text: We booked the Aqua Coconut at a great rate while the hotel was undergoing a renovation. We were very happy to find a bright clean happy atmosphere when we checked in. All of the staff were friendly and knowledgable. The room was clean and well decorated with huge flat screen tvs and a great little kitchen set up. The beds were so comfortable and I slept like a baby! The contintental breakfast they offered was basic but very good and considering it was free you can't complain. The beach and the main drag of Waikiki is just a short walk away. All in all this is a great hotel and I was very happy with my choice.
-Natalie
reviews.title: Waikiki

reviews.text: It was a very positive experience as we didn't know what to expect - being a Best Western Hotel. Staff was very friendly and professional. We felt welcome straight away. The rooms were very large, clean and cosy. We had a kitchenette if we decided to stay indoors and have dinner one night. There was a table and two chairs. A large plasma screen tv. Small but clean bathroom with an efficient shower. Nice soaps and schampoo bottles. The body lotion smelled lovely. Breakfast was served downstairs in the lobby with cereal, toast, danish, coffe and eggs.
reviews.title: Best Boutique Hotel in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall good reviews - couldn't have picked a better hotel for our stay. We will return - shortly!!
reviews.title: We were spoiled

likes.liked: — Great Shower, comfy bed, Mountain view, convenient bar fridge

reviews.text: If you want to stay in a beautiful, classy, clean, well-managed small hotel in Waikiki this is the place for you. I spend two weeks out of every eight weeks in Hawaii (for business) and I've stayed in a lot of different places. For a small hotel, this is the best. The atmosphere is serene, the service is excellent, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the big screen Samsung TV in my room was sweet! Many hotels in Waikiki have spent a lot of dough to remodel their lobbies, but their rooms don't stack up. The Coconut has been renovated throughout - there are no unpleasant surprises. A nice continental breakfast and Internet access in the lobby make this place perfect. Check it out!
reviews.title: EXCELLENT STAY

likes.liked: — ELEGANCE AT A REASONABLE RATE AND EXCELLENT SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just stayed at this hotel on 6/27-6/29/09 and absolutely loved it! We paid only $120 per night (got a 3-night special) and got all the amenities of an expensive boutique hotel. The hotel was immaculate from the moment we entered the lobby and got to our room. The front desk staff we so friendly and helpful. The free morning breakfast was delicious (I loved the breakfast sandwiches that had egg and sausage wrapped in sweet bread) and the outside terrace was peaceful.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel perfectly situated away from the crowds of Waikiki

reviews.text: Our room was spacious and we loved the new, contemporary decor. We had a balcony that overlooked one of the canals. It faced east, so we got to watch the sunrise each morning.
reviews.title: Fantastiacllt a wonderful experience starting and ending with Jay's gracious, helpfulness

reviews.text: They have a small pool with limited sun (which is nice after getting too much at the beach) and a nice patio area with lounge chairs. They also have an adequate work out room and complimentary computers with internet access and printers. They have valet parking for $22/night, but you can usually find free street parking along the canal, during the day.
reviews.title: Usually happy with no-frills Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps the BEST thing about this hotel is the location. We loved that it was not on the main drag of Waikiki, but still just a 5 minute, 3-block walk to the fabulous shopping and beaches of Waikiki. It's also situated toward the "Beverly Hills" end of Waikiki, so that was a great perk, too.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel! You want to stay at this hotel.

reviews.text: We have traveled all over the world and were absolutely surprised and pleased at this Best Western property. I booked my stay here because of other Trip Advisor reviews and am so thankful for relying on the members' feedback.
reviews.title: stay at this hotel you will not be sorry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel, located about 2 blocks away from Kalakua Ave, the main strip in Waikiki, Honolulu, is great. Our room overlooks the Ala Wai canal, is very quiet and clean. Room service is good and the reception staff are great. Complimentary breakfast. Close to everything.
reviews.title: Good service, quiet and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will stay there again if we visit Honolulu again.
reviews.title: Mountain View room with traffic and wall-shaking noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The advantage of a hotel facing Ala Wai Blvd such as the Ilima or BW Coconut is a nice open view of the mountains, Ala Wai Canal, and Ala Wai golf course. The disadvantages are greater distance from the beach, traffic noise, and gusty wind unbaffled by tall buildings.
reviews.title: a noisy start to the holiday

reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed a December 2008 one-night stay (room 504) at BW Coconut so much that we returned in July 2009 for 5 nights (room 405). We had to wait until 3 p.m. to check in to room 405. While rooms 504 and 405 both faced Ala Wai Blvd, the street noise seemed twice as loud in room 405, and the view was not nearly as good. We recommend mountain view floors 5 and above because there appears to be a world of street noise difference between the 4th floor and the 5th floor.
reviews.title: Highly recommended hotel in Waikiki

reviews.text: On the 4th floor we shared a corridor with several door slammers, including a couple who used slams to express their feelings as their quarrel extended into the corridor. When the heavy room doors slam at the BW Coconut, it shakes the corridor walls, The head of our bed was on the other side of a corridor wall, and the vibration was enough to jolt us out of sleep. Even the bed shook. Pneumatic gradual door closers would inexpensively prevent guests from giving their doors that extra little flip for a really satisfying slam that ensures doors will shut good and tight.
reviews.title: Great value (good spread of continental breakfast); Friendly front desk
Superb choice - great comfort and outstanding value
reviews.text: We booked this hotel six months in advance and got a great deal. Our room was very large and well maintained. Having recently been decorated, the bathroom and bedroom was clean, modern and just the temperature. A taste of luxury at almost budget prices; I was particulary fond of the large bed; something rare here in Europe! The only downside was the breakfast which was somewhat limited in variety with only a few tables indoors which meant that you had to hope that it wouldn't get too crowded or else face a windy terrace. The staff were helpful and the internet (and printers) were free - something which is fast becoming essential as airline companies often prefer you to check in on-line 24hours before departure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My tips? A higher level room is a good idea (though we didn't find the neighbourhood noisy) and if you're going to book car hire, opt for the nearby Enterprize Cars. The morning wait is more tolerable and air condtioned . We gave up waiting for our pre-booked car at Thrifty's after a one hour wait outside with no hope of being served for at least another hour.
reviews.title: So much for so little

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying the Best Western Coconut Waikiki is a great hotel! The price was very affordable and you get so much for very little money. Me and my husband came to Hawaii for a second honeymoon I looked at hundreds of hotels before deciding on this one. The room was gorgeous the decor was awesome it was just like it was pictured on the Internet. The staff was very friendly they checked on us everyday to make sure everything was to our liking. The room has a flat screen T.V. very comfortable bed free Wi-Fi in your room and not to mention FREE breakfast!! The room has a fridge and a microwave which is a live saver. Hubby and I walked to the food pantry that was in walking distance and bought food for lunch and this saved us on average about $100.00 per day. Average breakfast and lunch outside the hotel for two people will cost you at least 100-150$ per day. The microwave and fridge saves us a lot of money we had food and water in the room to have when ever we wanted so we had breakfast and lunch in the hotel daily. The hotel is in the best location walking distance to everything so really you'll waste your money if you rent a car. You're close to a trolley stop that will take you wherever you need to go. I was so pleased with my stay I told other people on my shuttle to the airport and trust everybody was amazed... I will be telling everybody about this top notch hotel. I will stay here again in the future. Karen Fisher-
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very nice. They give alot of effort to supply anything you need. The rooms are well decorated,the beds comphy ,the pillows soft. Bathrooms new and clean. Breakfast is good but got boring.after a few days. Location to shopping and restaurants excellent. Was always quiet. The negatives are: too far from the beach and very small pool. If you like to sit at a pool and have drinks this is not the place for you.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!
All Around Great Choice
reviews.text: The staff at the Best Western Coconut were some of the nicest people we have dealt with in our travels. The staff went out of their way to ensure that guests had whatever they needed to be comfortable. While many places we have stayed have attempted to "nickel and dime" people at every turn, the Best Western gives the whole package with no hidden expenses.
The whole operation at the Coconut was outstanding from every employee from the
reviews.title: Desk personnel were understanding and a great deal of knowledge

reviews.text: cleaning to the desk personnel which were always helpful with a high degree of knowledge of the area plus the bus schedules.
reviews.title: Lovely Family Place to stay

reviews.text: I have stay here at the Coconut 2 times and will be back again, I have been to Waikiki
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Easy and Friendly

reviews.text: 10 times and will be back again this year.
reviews.title: kindness for baby ^^

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regards,
reviews.title: cool, funky, friendly, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had read all the reviews & saw that the manager had cared enough to reply to the bad ones letting people know the place was being completely redone. All the reviews since the remodel were positive & the from the pictures it looked nice. My husband & I booked the "Queen City View". The place IS as nice as it looks online. Our room was very comfortable, nice & clean. The staff was very friendly. It's only 3 blocks away from shopping (high end to normal stores) & tons of places to eat around. We would stay there again!
reviews.title: Very Nice & Great Price!

likes.liked: — clean, comfortable, friendly staff, & walking distance to everything

reviews.text: Spent 7 nights at the Aqua Coconut Hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel---MUCH Better than expected

likes.liked: — Great Clean Modern Rooms, Very Friendly and Accommodating Staff
likes.disliked: — Didn't really matter but pool area is small and in the shade most of the day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel! We know that it was just renovated so we weren't expecting a "Wow" factor once we got there. Having been to Honolulu before, we've come to expect the "Basic" room types....we don't mind...as you don't spend that much time in your room anyways.
reviews.title: Our stay was wonderful!

likes.liked: — Convienent to waikiki and people were friendly and helpful
likes.disliked: — Extremely small pool and workout center. Bed was a little too soft.

reviews.text: Upon check in, the lobby looked exactly like on the website.....same with the rooms. Crystal was great...upgraded us to a mountain view room...and they even have fresh apples and oranges, complimentary, in the lobby area for you at all times :-)
reviews.title: Love the Aqua Coconuts

likes.disliked: — ???? I loved it all....Longer Martini Hour in the Lobby!!!

reviews.text: Room was nicely renovated and clean.....reminds me of a "W" type boutique look. Not bad for a $110/night rate that we got. (That's the average rate since we got 1 night free for the promotion on their website)
reviews.title: perfect place to stay

likes.liked: — The clean rooms and the location

reviews.text: Continental breakfast was decent. They had numerous types of cereals, oatmeal, bananas, oranges, and apples, along with mini pastries like croissants, and apple turnover type pastries and hard boiled eggs. They also had orange/pineapple juice, milk and coffee and teas. I think it is served from 7-930am.
reviews.title: Great Staff traffic noise UGH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an affordable hotel with nice amenities and beautiful room. It's 3 blocks away from the busy street of Waikiki but believe me it is a very easy walk! Plus this is a good place to rest because it's quiet and the bed is very comfortable! This hotel has an awesome breakfast everyday and 24 hours coffee service available. And most of all our stay here wouldn't be complete without the wonderful staff... They are so helpful, friendly and warm... They all sure show their ALOHA spirit to all their guest. I would definitely go back to this place.
reviews.title: Aloha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my staying at Coconut Waikiki....it's just few minutes walking away from waikiki beach, rooms are all silent (even at lower floors) and the view of Diamond Heads is great!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Facilities and staff were excellent. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Pleasant and satisfying stay.....would definitely consider coming back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was very nice! We were on a budget, and it was lovely! The free upgrade was explained over the phone, however, a week in advance--and unfortunately it set my hopes too high! (the phone description seemed to me almost like a corner penthouse suite, when in reality the space was a little bigger than the one we reserved, with an extra bathroom and couch and lanai, but a less-nice view in my opinion...). Overall they were friendly, and it was convenient to stuff, and clean and nice. The free breakfast was not that exciting, so we didn't use it the second day, but the color scheme was happy and OH YEA, people went out of their way to help us have a late check-out for free (held our bags a few hours while we mini-couped:-) Overall, we had no complaints. They also gave us some free goodies. Thanks again to everyone in Waikiki who was so nice to us!!!
reviews.title: Nice honeymoon-free upgrade-friendly staff-pleasant environment!

reviews.text: I'll start with the negatives, since there really aren't that many. The walk to the beach is a few blocks, and the only parking available is valet (though the rates are very reasonable). Aside from those two things, my experience here was perfect.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for more

reviews.text: My family and extended family stayed at this hotel in mid-Aug 2008. We were in Waikiki for a wedding. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff (Larissa, Mike, Jay, LeeAnn, Crystal, our housekeeper, the guy who manned the continental breakfast, you the get the picture) were excellent! They made us feel welcome and accomodated any request we had.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!!

reviews.text: At first we had booked a queen room, but it was too small for us, so we requested a larger room and they upgraded us to a king bed room that was much larger. We needed to fit a crib in the room (which they provided) and the king bed room worked great. I think the queen size room is the smallest room in their hotel. The rooms with the double beds were the same size as the king.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: The continental breakfast was good. We enjoyed it every morning. Our group had a couple toddlers and their was food that would work for them (cereal, whole milk, hardboiled eggs, oatmeal, fruit) as well as stuff for the adults (juice, danishes, coffee, tea, etc).
reviews.title: Memorable boutique experience...

likes.liked: — The gorgeous decor through out the whole place

reviews.text: The location was close to everything. You could walk to the beach in less than 10 minutes. Shopping was very close by and there were lots of restaurants nearby as well.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean, renovated rooms, comfy bed.

reviews.text: The only cons I could think of for this hotel were the $22 per day parking charge (nice that it is 24 hour access, but the price is still steep), the awkward driveway into the hotel, and the pool which was very small and not heated.
reviews.title: Aqua Coconut was the perfect place to stay

likes.disliked: — Location was three blocks from beach, size of rooms.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Aqua Coconut Waikikie and had a great experience. The newly remodeled hotel was quite pretty, had great decor, and the staff was friendly & helpful. We were on the 10th floor and never had to wait for elevators. The hotel was winin easy walking distance of everything at Waikiki, my 8 yr old did not even complain! We loved the 42" plasma TV.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Thought the coconut was an amazing waikiki find. the new renovations are done in unique colors and contemporary style. very clean, comfortable and easily accessed. VERY WELL DONE! Beds and bedding were great! Loved the continental breakfast......a touch that you don't often find in waikiki. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again!
reviews.title: LOVED IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Considered 'off the beaten path,' this hotel is considered 'far' from the beach...the beach is 5 strolling minutes away. A wonderful sunrise, this hotel faces the Ala Wai canal, a great place to people watch and workout. Everywhere is walkable within Waikiki from this hotel (but bear in mind my husband and I ran 5 km to Diamond Head, ran up, down, then back to the hotel, for fun).Rooms are well maintained, cute art deco decor, very modern and hip feel, the kitchen area is an appreciated feature! Business centre and free wifi came in handy, it was nice that printing was free. Breakfast is great for a bonus, some griped about the selection but I can't see why...food in Honolulu is expensive, appreciate this added benefit :)
reviews.title: lovely, quaint and wonderful

reviews.text: The staff are what make this hotel a gem, they're all fantastic.....treat them well!! remember to hang loose and remember where you are, mahalo :)
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my sister stayed at the Best Western Coconut Waikiki hotel while visiting Oahu for our Birthday. It was an enjoyable stay. The room and hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Very short walk to the beach and shopping. The continental breakfast was generous and tasty. The rooms are small but very comfortable. I would definitely recommend this budget friendly hotel to anyone visiting Oahu.
reviews.title: A tucked away Gem in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip together to Honolulu and had a roomed booked at the Best Western Coconut Waikiki. Upon arrival at 1:00am, we were greeted by friendly staff, quick check-in, map of the area, amenties of the hotel, towels available for the beach and if we needed anything we could ask the front desk. and we had a bell hop that helped us with our luggage to our room.
reviews.title: Loved the Breakfast

reviews.text: Our room was located on the 9th floor with a bacolny. The view directly acrossed from us was an apartment building and a partial view of the Ala moa Canal. The view didn't bother us as we were only in our room after 9:00pm and in the AM we were out by 7:30am to start our touring around. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, we slept like logs. The air conditioner was adequate enough for us.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, clean and comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful 2 night stay at the Aqua Coconut. The newly remodled rooms are modern and comfortable and very clean. We were surprised at how comfortable the beds are. It was nice to have a mini kitchenette in our room with a fridge and microwave. The only issue we had with the room was that the patio door was older and difficult to open/shut.
reviews.title: Would visit again

reviews.text: The location was nice too. Just 2 blocks to the strip it was very easy to get to where a lot of the main shopping and restaurants are.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and accomodating, valet parking was quick and easy, breakfast was basic, and we didn't check out the pool on this trip.
reviews.title: Best hospitality ever

likes.disliked: — some problems with the wireless internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend it for the rate and would choose to stay there again.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended! Wonderful Experience!

reviews.text: Our friends stayed at a similarly priced hotel and could not have been more dissapointed. I chose the Coconut.
reviews.title: Great find!!

reviews.text: I was recently in the Waikiki area on business, and I chose to stay at the Best Western Coconut based on Tripadvisor reviews. Indeed, the hotel is a convenient bargain compared with most others I have seen in the area. The lobby is small but cheery with a nice supply of fast, free computers for guest use and a helpful staff. The room I rented was not supposed to be a "view" room, but we did have a little bit of the beach off to one side...just beyond the seedy apartments next door. The neighborhood is a bit rough around the edges and single women might not feel comfortable walking around alone after dark, but it was not a bother for me. My only quibble: the air conditioner seemed poorly designed and turned on and off noisily all night long, as it didn't seem to have a continuous run selection. Other than that, all was well and I was pleased at the final bill.
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I love finding little gems in cities that tourists normally wouldn't think about. Growing up in the states, staying at a hotel associated with the Best Western doesn't sound like a very luxurious vacation for me, but hear me out! I had been to Oahu before and just couldn't find a hotel on the beach that felt worth shelling out $400/night. I have stayed at the W and the Moana Surfrider in the past. The W didn't have a pool or a view of the beach, which was quite silly for the price and the Moana Surfrider's common grounds were lovely, but the room was lacking. There were large water stains on the carpet the furniture needed updating. Since we were doing a 2 week tour through the islands, I decided we would find a cheaper hotel in Waikiki and up the ante as we proceeded through the islands. The Aqua was fantastic! It was about $130 night. There is no where in Waikiki that you can find a hotel for that price with this sort of quality. It was VERY clean and the rooms had been recently updated with cool ocean colored furnishings. There is a small pool, but we didn't bother and decided to walk over to the beach instead, which was a short stroll away. The staff were terribly friendly and helpful. People think you can't do Hawaii on a budget, but you can at this hotel!
reviews.title: A little gem in the heart of Waikiki

reviews.text: we stayed here for 12 nights over December. We had an executive suite which was very tidy and clean. The king size bed was extremely comfortable as i beleive it had a latex mattress. The pillows were also latex and very good quality. The breakfast in the lobby was adequate, however the staff at breakfast were not very communicative or helpful. The free internet was a bonus and the reception staff were very welcoming and cheerful. We had two lanai's overlooking the Ala Wai canal and the surrounding golf course...very pretty and quite quiet. The location of this hotel is perfect as it sits away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but is still close enough to be convenient. Overall, exceptional value. Ps...the BBQ facilities are very handy and kept very clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: I can't add much in this review that hasn't been covered elsewhere. Incredible value, amazing staff, family friendly, etc... I was prepared for a let-down after the sparkling comments on TripAdvisor, but my expectations were actually exceeded.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels, not just in Waikiki, but *anywhere*!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of days in December 2009 before taking a cruise around the islands, then stayed an extra a week with our "adult" children (25 & 26) upon our return. We had the trip of a lifetime, in part, because of the excellent service and accommodations at the Coconut.
reviews.title: Tremendous value

reviews.text: This hotel was reasonably priced with a good location. The staff was very helpful and the rooms comfortable. Most of all the price was right!
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel's decor, its convenient location, the comfort of our room, the value, and especially the service. Little touches like the pitchers of lemon-flavored water, receiving a room upgrade, and finding a fruit basket in our room sold us on this hotel. We'd stay here again!
reviews.title: Boutique-like feel at a very reasonable price

reviews.text: During my week in Honolulu, I stayed at three hotels: Best Western Coconut, the Marriott Waikiki and Waikiki Gateway. This hotel was best by far (and we paid considerably more for the Marriott Waikiki)
reviews.title: We will be back!!

reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable: moderately sized, room 40 inch LCD TV, well kept, clean bathrooms, comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.text: The location is good: Admittedly its not located on the main drag in Waikiki, but it is a very short walk 5 minute walk down Lewers St. Very safe at night.
reviews.title: exactly what we expected

reviews.text: We booked into the Aqua Coconut for one night to house us before we boarded our cruise ship. We are all delighted by the place. The reception area is clean, open and welcoming. The Guest Services staff were exceptionally friendly and welcoming. The room itself was easy to find and as impressive as the lobby. It was clean, nicely decorated and furnished and had all the amenities (a microwave, a proper fridge that was not a mini-bar and a sink to wash dishes). We had a nice lanai with a couple of chairs. We were expecting the continental breakfast to be (after past experience) nothing more than some soggy croissants, weak coffee and sludge passing for orange juice: what we got was a feast of pastries, toast, cereals and fruits. It was within walking distance of Waikiki beach and all the main amenities (you are never far from an ABC store wherever you stay…). If I had to find something amiss I would say that there was no safe in the room, the towels could have been a little bigger and taxis did not come to the door of the lobby, which meant an uphill climb with the luggage (or downhill trying to hold the luggage back). I would definitely go back and stay here.
reviews.title: Gem of a place

likes.disliked: — Small towels and difficult taxi access

reviews.text: I have to say that staying in Coconut Hotel is one of the best decision we have made. Not just the staff has been very helpful and friendly, the whole place has been renovated clean and refreshing!
reviews.title: Coconut - Surprisingly Delightful!

likes.liked: — New and Clean. Friendly staff and helpful. Wireless internet in the whole building!
likes.disliked: — aircond and bathroom fan is a bit loud.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It also has great huge TV, love the views and not too far from Waikiki beach. I would really like to thank for the special request room that you have accommodated me and my wife too.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: The only tiny thing that could be improved is that the fan in the bathroom and the air conditioning could be changed to a quieter ones... Apart from that, excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Have a Coconut!

likes.liked: — Proximity to Waikiki, friendly staff, free modern conveniences
likes.disliked: — Location of pool and it was too small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I was very happy to stay there and strongly recommend it to others who is considering staying in Waikiki.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Experience

description: The Coconut Waikiki Hotel is a refreshing blend of high-tech and mod design, our colorful Art Deco hotel offers a peaceful and playful vibe one block from shopping and only three block from Waikiki Beach. The hotel features a delightfully hip lobby and the following complimentary amenities: WiFi access in-room and throughout hotel, daily local newspaper, local & toll-free calls, 40" or 42" LCD TV's, wet bar, mini-refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker and safe. A small, intimate pool area with wrap around deck and fitness center are available to all guests.
